alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Espanola Valley; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; West Central Highlands; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 6:19PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...THUNDERSTORMS WITH MICROBURST WINDS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF MCKINLEY, RIO ARRIBA, NORTHWESTERN SANDOVAL AND SAN JUAN COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM MDT... At 617 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms with strong microburst winds and blowing dust along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Dulce to Blanco Trading Post and Navajo. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts around 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Farmington, Gallup, Kirtland, Bloomfield, Aztec, Shiprock, Chama, Cuba, Dulce and Navajo Dam. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 2 and 69. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 60 and 174. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 1 and 199. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Blowing dust associated with strong microburst winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.
